descriptionHTML:
Migraine is invisible on an MRI but very visible on a diary.
According to headache specialists, the most useful tool for the treatment of migraines is a migraine diary. Start a diary today and be empowered!

The Canadian Migraine Tracker helps you to keep a simple and focused Migraine Diary directly from your smart phone or tablet. Available on Apple and Android, in English and French.

Here are five good reasons to keep a diary:
‚Ä¢ Get a clear idea of your headache frequency and patterns
‚Ä¢ Use the data to work with your health care provider
‚Ä¢ Monitor the response to treatments (acute, preventive, behavioral)
‚Ä¢ Observe triggers
‚Ä¢ Watch medication overuse
‚Ä¢ Bonus: detect menstrual migraine!
Less is more: simple, focused and designed to optimize your discussions with your health care provider

You can monitor what is important for you: headache frequency but also triggers, symptoms and medication response.

We built this tool to make communication with your health care provider (family doctor, neurologist, nurse practitioner, pharmacist etc) easier. The App focuses on the information usually discussed with physicians. Our reports can be sent to your health care provider in two convenient ways: PDF and email.

We hope that you will find this application convenient and easy to use! Please share comments and rate the Canadian Migraine Tracker.

This APP is provided by the Canadian Headache Society¬†headachesociety.ca in collaboration with Migraine Canada migrainecanada.org and Migraine Qu√©bec migrainequebec.com.

This APP is produced by 3ALogic Inc. 3alogic.com.

Copyright ¬© 2019-2020, Canadian Headache Society.
summary: The Canadian Migraine Tracker helps you to keep a simple Migraine Diary.
recentChanges: We fixed a bug related to the selected start and stop dates of the Migraine Summary Report.
comments: Can't enter what time you took medication. Who doesn't need to know that? It's also very slow, like it is syncing after each thing you enter instead of after you've finished an entry. I did like that I could turn off tracking for all the things I don't need to make it quicker and easier to use when I have a migraine, but without being able to track medication, it is of no use to me.

The notes section is horrible. It always says "something went wrong" when I try to save my notes. So frustrating, especially after I write and then I cannot save them. How is this supposed to help me when I cannot even go back and read my notes? Notes are really important when trying to track my migraines! I only use this app because of my neurologist. I used migraine buddy app before and never had this issue.

Overall a good app, but there are a few limitations which need to be improved: 1) No capability to track actual mg or # pills taken for preventative or acute medications 2) The "Get Report" function doesn't pull in all of the acute medications listed in your profile (for me it pulled in 5 of 11) which defeats the purpose of the report 3) The "Get Report" function automatically checks "Aura" off for every day you have a migraine and includes "Menstruation" even if you aren't tracking that

Very useful app, there are some issues with it that others have mentioned. One quality of life improvement would be to remove the Ok dialogue box after setting a migraine free day. There should be no confirmation dialogue box as the day has a visual colour change.

It's pretty good. The impacts on your day only talks about work so doesn't apply to us retired folks as well. Perhaps some additional descriptors would help. Also my attacks kind of wax and wane throughout their 3to 4 day duration. I hadn't thought of each recurrence as a new attack but I can record them that way I guess. Also I have postdrome that lasts for a day or 2 and would love to be able to track those symptoms, treatments, activities that help etc. Love to have this record!

title: Beating Headaches and Migraine
description:
Up to 90% of the general population reported experiencing headaches at some point in their lives. Headache is a complex phenomenon. Many migraine attacks are caused by stress triggers. Some of them: 

‚Ä¢Stress and time pressure, major losses, anger and conflict. 
‚Ä¢Certain smells, tobacco smoke, light glare or dazzle, weather changes. 
‚Ä¢Monthly periods, birth control pills, estrogen therapy. 
‚Ä¢Too much, too little or interrupted sleep. 
‚Ä¢Hunger, fasting, specific foods or beverages. 
‚Ä¢Excessive activity. 
‚Ä¢Certain medicines 

Learning to avoid those triggers or your response to them can help in the treatment of migraines and tension headaches. Anything that helps you lower stress levels and encourage relaxation can be beneficial. The logical choice in this case is hypnosis, which can help with any kind of pain that is triggered by stress. 

This app is specially created to help you prevent and cope with the migraine symptoms. By regular listening you can learn to easily achieve the beneficial for your body and mind relaxation state.

title: Ada ‚Äì your health companion
description:
Ada helps you and your loved ones check symptoms and discover what might be causing them ‚Äì day or night without an appointment. Whatever‚Äôs bothering you, from stomach problems to headache, Ada‚Äôs free symptom checker can help you find answers and let you know if you should see a doctor.

 Join the 10 million people who have already downloaded the world's most popular symptom check.‚Ä® Doctors trained Ada for years, so you can get a prediagnosis within minutes. 


How do free symptom checks work?

You answer simple questions about your own or someone else‚Äôs health and symptoms.
Ada‚Äôs AI assesses your answers against its medical dictionary of thousands of disorders and medical conditions.
You receive a personalized assessment report that tells you what could be wrong and what to do next.


What can you expect from an assessment?

- Data privacy and security ‚Äì we apply the strictest data regulations to protect you and keep your information private.
- Smart results ‚Äì our core system connects medical knowledge with intelligent technology.
- Personalized health information ‚Äì your guidance is personal to your unique health profile. 
- Assessments for loved ones ‚Äì if you assess someone else, their information stays separate from your own. 
- Health checks ‚Äì your assessments include information that may be relevant and helpful to your doctor. 
- 24/7 access ‚Äì you can use the free symptom checker anytime, anywhere.


What can you tell Ada?

Ada answers medical questions of every kind. Here are some of the most common searches:

Symptoms
- Fever
- Allergic rhinitis
- Loss of appetite
- Headache
- Abdominal pain and tenderness 
- Nausea
- Fatigue
- Vomiting
- Dizziness


Medical conditions:
- Common cold 
- Influenza infection (flu)
- Viral sinusitis
- Diabetes
- Tension headache
- Migraine
- Chronic pain
- Fibromyalgia
- Arthritis
- Allergy
- Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
- Anxiety disorder
- Depression

Categories:
- Skin conditions such as rashes, acne, insect bites
- Pregnancy 
- Children‚Äôs health
- Sleeping problems
- Indigestion issues, such as vomiting, diarrhea
- Eye infections

Disclaimer
The Ada Health App is a Class I medical device in the European Union. Registration in other markets is pending.

We want to hear from you. If you have any feedback or just want to get in touch, reach us at hello@ada.com

comments: Pretty accurate heading. Again HEADING and not a diagnostic So people won't get it wrong about the app. Extremelly helpful, since the test I've inputed on was an already medical confirmed diagnosis and ADA has provided three oprions which one of them is the one I am on current medical treatment. So, I will definitely use it as a pre-docs visit since it helps to describe symptoms to the physician. First use no ads so far, which is great. Lets see if it stays this way.

I absolutely adore this app, I don't see myself ever getting rid of it. If you're ever unsure of what you have or need a guideline for what you may have, it is the most perfect app. It doesn't make you panic, it explains everything and is so calming when you're worried for the worst. Thank you to the creators! I adore this app and I'm so thankful for it!

This is a really awesome app, I use it every time I feel unwell. And it saved me so many trips to the doctor. The UI looks modern, descriptions of either symptoms or diseases is accurate while also easy to understand. And the best thing? it doesn't have ads, some kind of overpriced subscription or anything like that. this one is my must have.

It is generally a good app, but I put my symptoms in and it focused more on my mild headache and other small things than the actual problem that caused me to try this in the first place which was more important than that head ache, it does this quite a lot but other than this, it's quite good! It is a good way to track symptoms and I haven't seen many ads but it does need to work on the symptom assessment a bit more, but that said, it is hard to make that perfect but it can help.

This app is extremely helpful, I've used it dozens of times since I downloaded. Love that it remembers details about people other than me. It would be cool to have the option to import my medical records .... Not sure if that is something that would be possible to do? Either way, I've love this app, and it never takes long before I feel the need to download it onto a new phone.

title: migraine or headache guide
description:
You often have headaches, to the point that these headaches stun you several hours? It may be a sign of a migraine. How to recognize a migraine from a classic skull sickness? What is ophthalmic migraine? What treatments to overcome it? You are told everything to end these headaches
First sign of migraine: you have a headache. On one side or both, the location of the pain is often close to the eye. If your head seems stuck in a vise, you feel your heartbeat right up in the veins of your face, this is a migraine.

These headaches last more in time than a classic headache. Migraineurs tend to get used to analgesics and therefore have difficulty in clearing their migraine.

Strong headaches of this type can even result in temporary nausea or visual loss.

Migraine is a health disorder affecting many women, but also men. It would seem that the fact of being migraine can be transmitted by heredity.
to know more between here ....

title: Prevent Headache
description:
A great many people in the world have at one point or another, experienced headaches. They may say that they have a migraine or a tension headache. Some people will experience headache problems due to their sinuses. While suffering from headaches is an annoying problem knowing the cause of headaches may help to prevent further attacks. 

Headaches can be caused by a variety of reasons. They can be simple problems like eyestrain to the sinus cavities being inflamed. They can also arise from life threatening conditions like encephalitis, brain cancer or cerebral aneurysms. Sometimes a head injury will also be the cause of headaches.

These types of headaches are easy to find and treat. There are some headaches where the cause is some what elusive to diagnose immediately. Cluster headaches are one type of headache where the cause is a little difficult to state immediately. Cluster headaches are headaches that cause a sharp and very painful headache to the individual.

The Application contains basic tips to prevent headache. There are quite a few headaches types that we must deal with in our lives and knowing what the cause of headaches is, can help us to avoid situations that may trigger such painful attacks.

We are constantly working on making the content and functionality of our apps better. We are always excited to hear from you! If you have any feedback, questions, or concerns, please share with us at: http://apps-ticket.com

title: Headache Diary Pro
description:
Publisher: myVillage, Inc.
Category: Health: Headaches
Website: www.HealthDiaries.US
Name: Headache Diary Pro

Description:
Keeping a good record of headaches, headache frequency and pain levels associated with headaches is important for treatment of headaches. Headache Diary helps you keep track of your headaches, frequency and pain levels of headaches as well as medicines that you find effective. It also comes with graphs and reports that you can share with your healthcare provider. This Headache Diary Pro App include automated self-assessment of headaches types to help you determine the types of headaches you may be having.

Additional features of Headache Diary include treatment of headaches with Binaural mix of Delta Brain Waves that use Dr. Leonard Horowitz's healing frequency delivered in 10 minute doses.

If you suffer from Headaches and want to keep track of headache time, duration, triggers and effectiveness of medication, possible cause and type of headache with comprehensive reports that can be even shared with your healthcare provider for better treatment then this Headache Diary application is for you.

The Headache Evaluation/Test included with the Headache Diary Pro is designed as an aid in self-assessment of an individual's headache related experiences as part of the evaluation of headache complaints.  Individual items and patterns of item during evaluation process suggest questions that may be pursued in an assessment by a healthcare provider.  The items are responded to in a yes / no fashion.  The App automates the evaluation process of your headache complaints and performs an artificial-intelligence based protocol to determine headache types you may be having.

You can even share reports with your healthcare provider if you like for better treatment of your headaches to take advantage of personalized medicine protocols available today.

Headache Diary Lite Features:
1.	Friction Free User Interface
2.	Fast: Takes Only About a Minute
3.	Demographics Input, DOB, Race, Sex, Eye Color, Region
4.	Date, Time and Duration of Headaches
5.	Pain Level, Causes, Head Location, Headache Types
6.	Effect of Headache on Work, Home, Marriage, Job
7.	Effect of Medication Taken
8.	Effectiveness of Medicine
9.	User can Enter Notes
10.	Headache Summary Reports by Date that give, Headache Duration, Place, Pain Level and Cause
11.	Summary Graphs: Dates vs Pain Level and Duration
12.	Summary Report showing Medicine Taken and its Effectiveness
13.	Summary Report showing location and cause of headache
14.	Detailed Reports in PDF that can be shared with your healthcare provider

Headache Diary Pro Features:
1.	All of the above features
2.	Take our Artificial Intelligence Software Test
3.	Provides Objective Measure of Headaches and Possible Causes
4.	Test takes about 10 minutes
5.	Take as many tests as you like pause and resume at your pace
6.	See tests time line with 1st, 2nd and 3rd dominant symptoms
7.	Graph the time line for analysis
8.	See detailed reports
9.	Combined Diary and Test Timeline report summary
10.	Combined Diary and Test Timeline report graph
11.	Produce reports in PDF that can be shared with your healthcare provider

Our Goal:  Is to provide mobile solutions for objective actionable data that is cloud based to help document and evaluate headaches that empowers patients and clinicians to better manage your health. We provide objective actionable data that is cloud based to help document and evaluate headaches that empower patients and clinicians to better manage their health.

title: Remedies for Headaches
description:
Headache is a common problem in everyone‚Äôs life. Modern life is more stressful than it has ever been and the causes are supported by the intensifying climate, pollution, unhygienic food and so many more things. If you are regularly confronted by headaches, this app could be a wonderful tool to keep handy.

Most of us suffer from regular headaches. It may be as severe as migraine attacks or mild annoyances resulting from personal and workplace distractions. Headaches in all forms are quite painful and interfere with your work and concentration. Nothing goes right when your head is in a bad shape. It isn‚Äôt also advised to pop in a painkiller every time the pain comes back to haunt your life. The next time you suffer from a headache, you will have a great friend by your side.

Application contains following features:
1) Collection of Remedies for Headaches.
2) Favorites section for Headaches you likes to try.
3) Share Remedies for Headaches with other family and friends.

The treatments for headaches vary depending upon the reason of the same. This app provides some quick fix strategies that will both help as a long term solution and let you get back to what you were doing in a healthy and focused mind.

Doctors believe that the most common cause of headache is overheating of the body, dehydration and inefficient digestion. The solution would automatically be cooling off, either by drinking some cold water to sitting right in front of the AC! There are herbal, spiritual, homeopathic and allopathic methods to fight headaches. The treatment will also depend on the time of the day and your overall schedule. Our grandfathers will have just popped in a piece of ginger into their mouth to help their digestion.

This app provides easy tips including quick herbal remedies, exercises, lifestyle basics, coping with the environment, etc. Overall, it helps your concentrate better and gets rid of that irritating something in your head!
We are constantly working on making the content and functionality of our apps better. 

We are always excited to hear from you! If you have any feedback, questions, or concerns, please share with us at: http://apps-ticket.com

3) Share Remedies for Headaches with other family and friends.

The treatments for headaches vary depending upon the reason of the same. This app provides some quick fix strategies that will both help as a long term solution and let you get back to what you were doing in a healthy and focused mind.

Doctors believe that the most common cause of headache is overheating of the body, dehydration and inefficient digestion. The solution would automatically be cooling off, either by drinking some cold water to sitting right in front of the AC! There are herbal, spiritual, homeopathic and allopathic methods to fight headaches. The treatment will also depend on the time of the day and your overall schedule. Our grandfathers will have just popped in a piece of ginger into their mouth to help their digestion.

This app provides easy tips including quick herbal remedies, exercises, lifestyle basics, coping with the environment, etc. Overall, it helps your concentrate better and gets rid of that irritating something in your head!
We are constantly working on making the content and functionality of our apps better.

We are always excited to hear from you! If you have any feedback, questions, or concerns, please share with us at: http://apps-ticket.com

title: Migraine Headache
description:
Alert:- This is a Completely offline app which means the data are stored in your device. So once you uninstall the app, all the data will be removed permanently. So think before you uninstall this app.

What is a Migraine Headache? 
A Migraine can cause severe throbbing pain or a pulsing sensation, usually on just one side of the head. It's often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and extreme sensitivity to light and sound. Migraine attacks can cause significant pain for hours to days and can be so severe that the pain is disabling.

Persons who got affected by a migraine needs to keep track of when they had the attack. 

So that they can easily figure out what causes the attack. 

This app makes it easy to keep track of the attacks.

Thanks:- https://www.healthline.com/health/natural-ways-to-reduce-migraines

title: Headache Protocols
description: Almost everyone has had a headache. Headache is the most common form of pain. It's a major reason people miss days at work or school or visit the doctor. The most common type of headache is a tension headache. Tension headaches are due to tight muscles in your shoulders, neck, scalp and jaw. They are often related to stress, depression or anxiety. You are more likely to get tension headaches if you work too much, don't get enough sleep, miss meals, or use alcohol. According to Ellen Drexler, MD, director of the headache center at Maimonides Medical Center in New York City, "Avoidance or management of stress, relaxation exercises, yoga, meditation, and other alternative medicine treatments can certainly be effective for many people, since stress is such a common headache trigger." According to guidelines published by the National Headache Foundation (NHF), once you have an accurate headache diagnosis and have been assured that your pain is not related to any other serious condition, your headache treatment can be improved by the addition of alternative therapies. Traditionally, complementary and alternative medicine has been considered outside the realm of conventional medicine. Western medicine has focused on the acute treatment of disease and injury, whereas CAM typically promotes health and prevention of disease. Yet this distinction is changing. Complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) refers to an array of healing practices and medicines that exist outside of conventional treatments. These practices are thought to provide a more natural and holistic approach to healing a variety of ailments. Many people across the globe find success in getting relief from their headaches with alternative techniques. This app is an ultimate solution. This is a Wellness app which you can do it yourself. However one may need Medical or Expert advice for certain protocols. We have protocols for Acupressure, Acupuncture, Aromatherapy, Ayurveda, Homeopathy, Bach Flower Remedy, Color Therapy, Diet and Nutrition, Exercise, Herbal Therapy, Juice Therapy, Physiotherapy, Reflexology, Shiastu, Sound Therapy, Tai Chi, TCM, Vitamin Therapy, Yoga, Sujok, Auricular Therapy, Hydrotherapy, Rife Therapy, Visualization, Rekhi, Magnet Therapy. These protocols when used under proper guidance gives more better feeling and as all the protocols are complementary / alternative therapy it comes with no side effects on application. For one problem - Headache, this app provides you 26 different methods to relieve you from headache and that to absolutely FREE!!!

title: Health Log
description:
Health Log makes it quick and easy to track your health related information. Health Log provides an extremely flexible logging system making it easy to keep track of any health related information such as headaches, cramps, coughs, colds, nausea, anxiety, depression, menstruation, arthritis, allergies, panic attacks, seizures, specific mental states and any other custom records. With each record you can record the severity of the event as well as the kind of pains, locations of the pain, potential triggers, any medications taken and if they provided relief.

‚Ä¢ Fast, simple and straightforward way to log and track and health event
‚Ä¢ Keeping logs of your health can help find the causes, most effective treatment and give a better general understanding of your health
‚Ä¢ Extremely customize-able with the ability to track any information you want such as any type of pain/symptom any location where the pain is, any potential triggers, and medication and the quantity taken
‚Ä¢ Health records can be shown to doctors to give them solid information to help diagnose any potential issues
‚Ä¢ Track the severity of headaches, cramps, coughs, colds, nausea, anxiety, depression, menstruation, arthritis, allergies, panic attacks, seizures and any other custom information
‚Ä¢ Track when headaches, cramps, coughs, colds, nausea, anxiety, depression, menstruation, arthritis, allergies, panic attacks and any other custom event happens and for how long
‚Ä¢ Track the type of pain associated with a health event such as migraine, throbbing, dull, sharp nausea and many more. Custom pains can be added as well
‚Ä¢ Track the locations of a health event such as temples, sinus, forehead and many more. Custom locations can be added as well
‚Ä¢ Track the potential triggers of health events such as stress, lack of sleep, loud noises, sunlight and many more. Custom triggers can be added as well
‚Ä¢ Track the medications and the quantities taken for such as ibuprofen (Advil), acetaminophen (Tylenol), antihistamines and any other custom medication
‚Ä¢ Track the relief experienced by medications or treatments
‚Ä¢ Update records quickly and easily to adjust for changes in your health event
‚Ä¢ View a variety of statistics about your records such as how many headaches, cramps, coughs, colds, nausea, anxiety, depression, menstruation, arthritis, allergies, panic attacks or seizures have been recorded, how many days since your last health event, average severity, average duration, most common pains, locations and medications
‚Ä¢ View statistics related to any specific recorded association, such as how many headaches, cramps, coughs, colds, nausea, anxiety, depression, allergies, panic attacks or seizures are associated with a pressing pain, or stress as a trigger
‚Ä¢ View your events in a calendar view. Quickly and easily update, delete or add new events from the calendar view. The calendar view can be useful in finding patterns in health events
‚Ä¢ View your events on a graph by year, month week or all health events at once. The graph view can be useful in finding patterns in health events

Upgrade
‚Ä¢ Upgrade Health Log to enable exporting your records as a spreadsheet that can be viewed with any spreadsheet reading program such as Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel
‚Ä¢ Upgrading enables the option to export your logs as a database backup that can be used to restore your records on a new device when switching phones or on the same phone. Includes Dropbox automatic syncing to easily switch between devices as well as make manual backups to Dropbox
‚Ä¢ Upgrading removes ads

Customization
‚Ä¢ Choose to have times displayed in AM/PM or 24 hour format
‚Ä¢ Select which day of the week to be the first day of the week
‚Ä¢ Select which statistics you wish to view on the home screen

Health Log can be an effective health log, health tracker, fitness trackers, health diary, headache tracker, headache diary, useful for headache tracking, head ache prevention and stopping head aches

recentChanges:
- Added ability to sort records by date, severity, and relief
- Added summary option when viewing records

comments: So far this is excellent. I was recently diagnosed with depression and need to keep track of my symptoms as well as effects of medications. Most of the other apps have a pre-set list of symptoms, and user is limited to those symptoms. This app allows you to create your own labels for symptoms, so you can be very specific with tracking your health issues. Also, the app creates a nice graph for visual representation of your symptoms. This app is exactly what i needed.
I was searching for a log which seemed to be quite difficult until I found health log. You can add symptoms to the list, and pain levels. Just what I wanted.

HELP option needed. It does everything I need so far. Had to read 100+ reviews to find developer comments to learn how to use, how to edit, etc. A "how to/help" in the dropdown menu is missing. Also, haven't yet figured out tracking >1 person. I got this to track my kid but would like to add myself. Overall it works well so far. Also, I haven't upgraded. Access to the full version (3day trial) would probably yield more upgrades. If full is just ad removal I'm ok with ads
Good pain track and has a calendar view. Handy for a cancer patient like me. I haven't upgraded so far but i'll see in a few days when i need to backup.
Really useful to track so I can keep my doctors up to date. However this morning when I went to sort categories it crashes everytime! EDIT: All fixed! Rating edited to 5 stars.

title: Nerivio
description:
Control your Nerivio device and track your migraine headaches.

The Nerivio app controls the Nerivio device - a wireless remote electrical neuromodulation device for the acute treatment of migraine with or without aura in patients 18 years of age or older who do not have chronic migraine. This prescription device is self-applied to the upper-arm and should be used in the home environment at the onset of migraine headache or aura.

Track your headaches and migraine symptoms in an easy-to-use advanced migraine diary which is included in the app.

For detailed information on the Nerivio device, please refer to www.theranica.com

Nerivio‚Ñ¢ is a prescription device. Use the Nerivio device and this app only if you have a valid prescription and after consulting with your health care professional.

recentChanges:
1. Support multi language on the GIER video (Spanish and English)
2. Support multi languages on instructional videos
3. Enable refilling more than one device
4. Auto storing account details on the phone
5. Questionnaires enhancements
comments: Such a good working device! The app asks too many questions, yet I believe it's good to follow up on migraines.

Maybe this works for some headaches. I'm still out on that. The big problem is that it requires you to have your location on to start it up. Creepy. There is no need for location tracking to treat a headache. Oh, but they say your data will not be shared. BS. The second problem is the post survey question about treatment before using the nerivio. The medications list does not allow for multiple selections. Really? Who treats headaches with just one medicine? I use up to three in tandom.

this company/app requires far too many permissions and is a major invasion of privacy and HIPAA for what it does. they want to track locations, date of birth, usage, phone info, and other personal data for self gain and or to sell to other companies.... there is no way to use this device with out the app installed. Junk and don't waste your time less you don't care about your data and privacy
Does not work with android 11
Cool and convenient application

title: Migr√§ne App
description:
Die Migr√§ne-App ist ein Meilenstein in der Vorsorge und Behandlung von Migr√§ne und Kopfschmerzen. Sie wurde in enger Zusammenarbeit von Experten der Schmerzklinik Kiel, des bundesweiten Kopfschmerzbehandlungsnetzes und der Techniker Krankenkasse entwickelt. Die Migr√§ne- und Kopfschmerz-Selbsthilfe-Communities auf Facebook und www.headbook.me begleiteten kontinuierlich die Entstehung mit. Die neue Migr√§ne-App er√∂ffnet v√∂llig neue M√∂glichkeiten in der digitalen Versorgung von Migr√§ne und Kopfschmerzen. Sie begleitet und steuert den pers√∂nlichen Behandlungsverlauf. Sie liefert Orientierung und bahnbrechende neue M√∂glichkeiten, was in Sachen Dokumentation, Diagnostik, wirksame Behandlung, Vermeidung von Chronifizierung, Messung der schmerzbedingten Behinderung, Entspannung, Stressabbau, Wissen, Information, Ern√§hrung und Fitness wirklich z√§hlt. Sie erm√∂glicht zudem den bundesweiten Austausch und die digitale Vernetzung sowohl von Betroffenen untereinander als auch mit Migr√§ne- und Kopfschmerzexperten. Wenn sie Anregungen haben, senden sie diese bitte an uns √ºber app@schmerzklinik.de

Die Migr√§ne-App er√∂ffnet den Nutzern, eine aktive Rolle bei der effektiven und zeitgem√§√üen Vorbeugung und Behandlung ihrer Migr√§ne und Kopfschmerzen zu √ºbernehmen. Sie gibt individuell einen √úberblick √ºber Behandlungspl√§ne und hilft personalisiert bei der Umsetzung von Leitlinien. Ein ‚ÄûCockpit‚Äú mit Anzeigeinstrumenten auf der Begr√º√üungsseite informiert √ºber alle relevanten Daten zur Akutbehandlung und Vorbeugung. Sie √ºberwacht Symptome und Medikamente. Sie stellt aktive Behandlungsverfahren wie die progressive Muskelrelaxation f√ºr die Vorbeugung zur Verf√ºgung. Der Migr√§ne- und Kopfschmerzverlauf wird kontinuierlich dokumentiert und analysiert. Ausl√∂sefaktoren wie z. B. Wetterdaten werden automatisch dem Verlauf hinzugef√ºgt, um Zusammenh√§nge zwischen Wetterver√§nderungen und Migr√§ne pers√∂nlich zu erfassen. Die Migr√§ne-App warnt bei √úberschreiten der Einnahmegrenzen von Akutmedikation. Sie hilft aktiv, Komplikationen wie den Medikamenten-√úbergebrauch-Kopfschmerz (M√úK) zu vermeiden. Die Behinderung durch Migr√§ne- und Kopfschmerzen kann so durch die digitale Technik aktiv wirksam reduziert werden. 

Ein Schnelltest hilft bei der Erfassung des Kopfschmerztyps. Skalen ermitteln das Risiko der Kopfschmerzchronifizierung und den optimalen Einnahmezeitpunkt f√ºr die Akutbehandlung. Experten des bundesweiten Kopfschmerzbehandlungsnetzes k√∂nnen wohnortnah gefunden werden. Eine Mediathek informiert √ºber aktuelle Nachrichten zur Migr√§ne- und Kopfschmerzbehandlung. Die App stellt die Kriterien der aktuellen internationalen Kopfschmerzklassifikation ICHD-3 beta digital zur Verf√ºgung. Betroffene k√∂nnen sich √ºber die sozialen Netzwerke Headbook und die Facebook Migr√§ne Community online austauschen und vernetzen. Ein regelm√§√üiger Live-Chat erm√∂glicht es, Kopfschmerzexperten der Schmerzklinik Kiel Fragen zu stellen, die direkt beantwortet werden.

Datenschutz
Die Migr√§ne-App speichert Daten nur auf dem Ger√§t des individuellen Nutzers. Datenschutzrechtliche Anforderungen werden eingehalten. M√∂chte der Nutzer Informationen weitergeben, z. B. an seinen behandelnden Arzt, erfolgt dies nur durch aktive Initiative des Nutzers. 

Service-Seite
Ein Video-Tutorial ist in der App integriert. Eine ausf√ºhrliche Service-Seite mit ausf√ºhrlicher Bedienungsanleitung findet sich unter https://schmerzklinik.de/die-migraene-app/

Die Migr√§ne-App warnt bei √úberschreiten der Einnahmegrenzen von Akutmedikation. Sie hilft aktiv, Komplikationen wie den Medikamenten-√úbergebrauch-Kopfschmerz (M√úK) zu vermeiden. Die Behinderung durch Migr√§ne- und Kopfschmerzen kann so durch die digitale Technik aktiv wirksam reduziert werden.

Ein Schnelltest hilft bei der Erfassung des Kopfschmerztyps. Skalen ermitteln das Risiko der Kopfschmerzchronifizierung und den optimalen Einnahmezeitpunkt f√ºr die Akutbehandlung. Experten des bundesweiten Kopfschmerzbehandlungsnetzes k√∂nnen wohnortnah gefunden werden. Eine Mediathek informiert √ºber aktuelle Nachrichten zur Migr√§ne- und Kopfschmerzbehandlung. Die App stellt die Kriterien der aktuellen internationalen Kopfschmerzklassifikation ICHD-3 beta digital zur Verf√ºgung. Betroffene k√∂nnen sich √ºber die sozialen Netzwerke Headbook und die Facebook Migr√§ne Community online austauschen und vernetzen. Ein regelm√§√üiger Live-Chat erm√∂glicht es, Kopfschmerzexperten der Schmerzklinik Kiel Fragen zu stellen, die direkt beantwortet werden.

Datenschutz
Die Migr√§ne-App speichert Daten nur auf dem Ger√§t des individuellen Nutzers. Datenschutzrechtliche Anforderungen werden eingehalten. M√∂chte der Nutzer Informationen weitergeben, z. B. an seinen behandelnden Arzt, erfolgt dies nur durch aktive Initiative des Nutzers.

Service-Seite
Ein Video-Tutorial ist in der App integriert. Eine ausf√ºhrliche Service-Seite mit ausf√ºhrlicher Bedienungsanleitung findet sich unter https://schmerzklinik.de/die-migraene-app/
summary: The migraine app is a milestone in the prevention and treatment of migraine.
developer: Schmerzklinik Kiel - Prof. Dr. Hartmut G√∂bel
recentChanges: Dieses Update erm√∂glicht die Registrierung in der ‚ÄûZukunftsregion Digitale Gesundheit (ZDG)‚Äú, eine Initiative des Bundesministeriums f√ºr Gesundheit. Dazu m√ºssen Sie von Ihrer √Ñrztin oder Ihrem Arzt eingeladen werden und einen Registrierungscode erhalten. Nach dem √ñffnen der App gehen Sie bitte zum Men√ºpunkt Einstellungen. Unter ZDG geben Sie den Registrierungscode ein. Sie finden dort auch weitere Informationen. Wenn Sie nicht teilnehmen, k√∂nnen Sie die Migr√§ne-App wie sonst benutzen.

Wonderful to keep track of your headaches and use of medication
I like it : )

Sehr praktische App f√ºr die die sie brauchen mit vielen n√ºtzlichen Funktionen wie Schmerzkalender, progressive Muskelentspannung und Expertensuche. Einen Stern Abzug gibt es weil beim √ñffnen der App laufende Musik in anderen Apps pausiert wird. Das ist einfach etwas nervig und ich kann den Grund daf√ºr nicht nachvollziehen, ansonsten gibt es aber nichts auszusetzen.

Gef√§llt mir soweit. Mir ist aber aufgefallen, dass die Aura Demo Videos Typ 1 und 2 im Vergleich zu den Youtube Videos vertauscht sind. Die Stra√üe war auf Youtube Typ 2 und in der App ist die Stra√üe bei Typ 1 zu finden.

title: Migraine Remedies
description:
Stop Chronic Migraine Pain and Tension Headaches From Destroying Your Life‚Ä¶

 

Proven steps anyone can take to overcome even the worst chronic head pain‚Ä¶

Are you someone that suffers from:

¬∑        Tension Headaches

¬∑        Migraine Headaches

¬∑        Cluster Headaches

¬∑        Stress Headaches‚Ä¶

Here‚Äôs a sneak peak at what you‚Äôll learn:

¬∑         What types of medical treatments are suitable for the type of headache you have, and how to talk to your doctor about them‚Ä¶

¬∑         What natural remedies are worth trying if you suffer from this type of headache‚Ä¶

¬∑         Find out if you can prevent your headache using preventative drugs including Imitrex or Relpax, or take advantage of natural remedies that prevent headaches‚Ä¶

¬∑         Find out why it is so important to keep a headache diary, and how to start your very own, so you and your doctor can work closely to uncover the cause for your distress‚Ä¶

¬∑         And much more!

Everyone knows what a headache feels like, but not everyone enjoys the ease of relief available‚Ä¶

Your brain is packed full of nerve endings that if triggered in just the right way, they send out pain signals to your head, resulting in you guessed it‚Ä¶ headaches!

BUT‚Ä¶ nobody deserves to be in pain most of the time. Headaches are one of the most common problems people face in the modern world. In fact, migraines rank as the 19th most common cause for disability.

What can you do about it?

Having severe headaches interfere with your ability to work and play. It‚Äôs time you found relief from your headache. Even if you suffer from occasional headaches, it‚Äôs time you found out what the exact cause is so you can find the perfect treatment!

When it comes to headaches, you will find that it is a condition that will be painful in the head, neck, and even back area. You will need to understand that the headache is not always just a pain. It could mean a sign of some sort and you will need to see a doctor if you get a lot of headaches. When it comes to symptoms or being a sign, you will need to consider that it is very rarely anything but a headache, but you will want to see a doctor if the headaches are persistent. 

As for causes for the headaches, you will find that it could be tension, eye strain, low blood sugar, sinuses, and even dehydration. You will also find that it could be a symptom of some life-threatening conditions like high blood pressure, brain tumors, and meningitis. You will also get a headache if you are injured in the head. Head trauma is very serious and you should seek medical treatment. You will also notice that the headache could simply be a part of your menstrual cycle, because you are fluctuating in estrogen levels. 

As for treatment you will be able to take some of the over-the-counter painkillers like Ibuprofen or aspirin. This will help you to get rid of the headache, but you will want to avoid some of your triggers, if you are able to identify them. Things like stress and even particular foods should be avoided in order for you to avoid having a headache. You will also want to seek medical attention if you feel that your headaches are persistent.

Most of your headaches are going to be nothing at all, however, you will still want to get checked out so that you can avoid having it manifest into something that is very serious. You will need to keep in mind that you will want to keep a headache journal. This way you can identify if you just have some specific trigger. Often your headaches will mean nothing, but it is always safe to jot down what you were doing when you got the headache and rather or not you have anything in common with other headaches. This way you can simply avoid the food or activity that makes you get headaches.

title: Dino run - Headache 2D
description:
There was one small village and it prospered thankfully to 4 dinosaurs and brave warriors. And everything would be fine if not for one evil wizard who is obsessed with their energy.

 In order to collect all the dinosaurs, he turned the village into the dark forest and the villagers into monsters. A need to organize a squad to fight with the wizard has appeared. Despite the dinosaurs, the squad contains other heroes, which haven‚Äôt been taken up by the spell of the wizard.Help the heroes to run away from this forest!

title: Migraine Sensor
description:
*****
ATTENTION: This application is in the testing phase and is part of a personal research project. I offer it free of charge and without ads and my intention is that it always be so. If you have any problems or suggestions, you can help me improve the app by writing an email to the address below. My intention is to continue improving the application so that it is as useful as possible. Please, before evaluating the application negatively, write to me.
Thank you.
*****
This application tries to predict the probability of suffering a migraine, headache or headache due to sensitivity to meteorological changes and mainly due to changes in atmospheric pressure.
Although not yet scientifically proven, there are several studies that link changes in atmospheric pressure with headaches and migraines.
This application evaluates the changes in pressure in the city that is indicated and notifies the user by means of a notification in case the probability of migraine increases.
For the prediction to work correctly, the application updates the meteorological data every hour in the background, although it is possible to deactivate the automatic update in the settings.
This application is in the testing phase and does not guarantee the reliability of the predictions.

recentChanges:
Added high, low and medium pressure levels in the graph
Migraine risk notifications updated
comments: I love that it gives the pressure in the air and is spot on with the pain that I have. I also like the fact of being able to track daily headache pain. I wish you could also add the pressure at the time of that reading to the migraine registry. It would help me better track and figure out my migraines. I have been looking for something like this for a long time.

Helpful. I installed it because I get migraines when the pressure changes. I felt one coming on and what do you know? It actually suggested there was an increased risk of migraine. Took medication and I may have avoided the brunt of it because of this confirmation.

I'm having the same problem as others, I can't pull up my location no matter how I enter it. I really want to try this out, so I hope it gets fixed. Update: working much better. 90% of the time when I have a migraine, the app has a medium to high warning.
Using it to measure the impact of weather on my migraines. Great so far!
No matter what the pressure it, the chance of a migraine always says low risk! I find that hard to believe

title: Music to Beat Migraines
description:
A migraine headache can cause intense throbbing or a pulsing sensation in one area of the head. A migraine attack can cause significant pain for hours to days and be so severe that all you can think about is finding a dark quiet place to lie down.  This app features the perfect music to calm you down and relax your system. 

Pt.Katti is a renowned Sitar player from India has been researching on this subject for some time now. He says it is built on four major aspects - modern medical inventions as described in the experiment about neuro-hormonal secretions, traditions and application of Indian classical music, mood elevation theory and fundamental principles of Ayurveda. Ragas have strict rules and regulations about their swaras, ascending and descending order (aaroha-avaroh), time theory, etc. Hence every raga, he says, "Has its own melodic atmosphere, which affects our mood and the sense of well being."

We would love for you to rate us positively on the App store please. It won't even take 30 seconds & will go a long way in helping us build better apps for you.

Criticism??? Please write to us on apps@winjit.com & we will write back to you. 

We can't have you unhappy, can we?

Thanks,
Team Winjit

comments: outdated, won't work on newer phone. Was a great product before now won't load on a pixel 3
no loud indian music made more migraine
am happy it really works
Don't waste your time

Really helps relieve a migraine. I've had migraines for many years and I was skeptical that sitar music would work as some sitar music can be annoying. But this somehow works! The Raag Darbari works to relieve my head, however the Raag Ramkali does not. On a side note, some of these sitar tunes remind me of The Beatles Help album where there is a really upbeat sitar tune that always puts me in a good mood. Maybe the sitar has a gift. I wish I understood it more. Anyway, THANK YOU developers for the app and the relief it has brought me. Many thanks!

Simple and organized; has a user-friendly interface! A very helpful app!

title: Sinus Headache Relief - Tips and Solutions
description:
IMPORTANT:
*Users who have APKs with previous version, may need to receive android.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE permission*

_________________


Sinus headache relief can be either temporary or permanent. Of course permanent relief is more desirable but as we will see some remedies bring immediate but not permanent relief. Sometimes we desperately need immediate relief, for permanent relief takes time. Incidentally it is important to be able to tell whether your headache is sinus related or whether it is migraine.


In this app, we will discuss about:

‚Ä¢ Everything You Need to Know About Sinusitis
‚Ä¢ Natural Sinus Headache Relief - Ways to Prevent Sinus Headaches
‚Ä¢ 10 Natural Remedies for Sinus Pain
‚Ä¢ Sinus Headache Relief - Sinus Pressure Points
‚Ä¢ Sinus Headache Symptoms and Treatments
‚Ä¢ 7 Powerful Home Remedies For Sinus That Bring Relief Naturally
‚Ä¢ Sinus Infection Symptoms, Antibiotics, and Alternative Medicine


[ Features ]

A little explaination about Sinus Headache Relief:

Sinusitis is a common inflammation of the paranasal sinuses, the cavities that produce the mucus necessary for the nasal passages to work effectively.
It can be acute or chronic, and it can be caused by viruses, bacteria, fungi, allergies, or even an autoimmune reaction.

Although uncomfortable and painful, sinusitis often goes away without medical intervention. However, if symptoms last more than 7 to 10 days, or if there is a fever or a bad headache, you should see your doctor.

Sinuses are spaces in the bones of the face. There are four pairs across the cheeks, bridge of the nose, and above the eyes. Scientists are not entirely sure what role the sinuses play in the body. It is possible that they make the skull lighter, prevent heat from escaping the head, or help make the voice louder.

Sinus headache relief depends on the underlying cause. A mild sinus headache can often be treated at home. depends on the underlying cause. A mild sinus headache can often be treated at home.

title: Migraine Trainer
description:
Migraine Trainer provides self-management tools and resources to help users ages 13+ understand the causes of their migraines, and take a greater role in their treatment with an individual migraine management plan.  Key features include action steps, daily goals, and cognitive exercises.  

This app was created by the National Institutes of Health, National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke. NIH is the nation's medical research agency, includes 27 Institutes and Centers and is a component of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. NIH is the primary federal agency conducting and supporting basic, clinical, and translational medical research, and is investigating the causes, treatments, and cures for both common and rare diseases.

title: Bearable - Symptoms & Mood tracker
description:
‚úÖ All health tracking in one place

Tired of juggling multiple apps to keep track of your mood, symptoms, sleep, exercise, diet, and medication? We think all of this should be kept in one convenient place so that you and your health professional can get the full picture.

‚úÖ Reclaim control over your well-being

Bearable empowers people to reclaim control over their well-being by making mood and symptom tracking simple, convenient, and accessible to all. Making entries in our health diary is quick and effortless, so you can focus more energy on getting better.  

The app has been shaped by our community of thousands of people with varying chronic health issues.

‚úÖ Gain useful insights with just a few clicks a day

With just a few simple clicks each day our intelligent health diary can help you to gain insights into which daily activities and health factors are positively and negatively affecting your mental and physical health.


Bearable helps you to:

‚úîÔ∏è Record your mood and symptoms in seconds, or go into more detail with an additional note. 
‚úîÔ∏è Fully customise your daily activities and health factors, such as sleep, diet, exercise and medication/supplements. 
‚úîÔ∏è Gain insights into how your daily activities and health factors impact your mood and symptoms using our graphs, calendar and stats pages.
‚úîÔ∏è Keep everything in one place with our neat health timeline, so that you can get the full picture. Use our search function to filter just what you want to see or show your health professional.
‚úîÔ∏è Come prepared to your next doctor or therapist appointment - no need to struggle to remember a detailed health timeline for the last week or month.
‚úîÔ∏è Make journaling a healthy habit with our quick, simple and enjoyable entry process.

And there‚Äôs much more‚Ä¶

‚ûï Set Reminders - Fully customise your reminders, whether it's a general reminder to make a diary entry or a reminder to take your medication and supplements. 
‚ûï Share and Export -  Export data securely to yourself or your health professional
‚ûï Automatic health data sync - You can choose to allow the app to automatically gather data such as Sleep and Steps taken from your phone.
‚ûï Dark mode - Change at night to a display easier on the eyes.
‚ûï Restore data across devices - Restore your data between Apple & Android devices.


üîê PRIVATE & SECURE

Rest easy knowing your data is encrypted securely on our servers. You have full control over your data and can delete it from within the app at any time.  It‚Äôs important to emphasise that we will never under any circumstances sell any personal data to anyone.


üíü MADE BY PEOPLE WHO UNDERSTAND AND CARE

Created by individuals who have lived with mental and physical health issues themselves.  With feedback and feature requests from a research group of thousands of people with a wide variety of chronic diseases and health conditions, including Anxiety, Depression, CFS (ME), MS (Multiple Sclerosis), Fibromyalgia, Endometriosis, Bipolar, BPD, PTSD, Migraines, Headaches, Vertigo, Cancer (Chemo Symptoms), Arthritis, Crohns, Diabetes, IBS and IBD.  Our aim is to make our symptom tracker simple and accessible to everyone, even if suffering from the fatigue and brain fog that often accompanies many conditions.

We have created a real sense of community around Bearable and will continue to listen closely to those who need it most.  We are committed to continue improving upon this app that could help many people start to feel like they can reclaim control over their health.  If you have any questions, feedback or feature requests, please send them over to james@bearable.app.  We‚Äôd love to hear from you.




Credit to Freepik for icons

comments: This is absolutely the best of its kind. I have never seen such a comprehensive, customizable, well-designed app that serves as many functions as this one. I've already shown it to multiple friends/therapists. For those of you moaning about the cost... seriously, getting the subscription will set you back just over $2/month. I work professionally with highly impoverished individuals who do have to count every penny, but come on. Most people can shell out a couple bucks without harm.

The app lets you log your mood, any symptoms you are having, and a number of factors that you think may be affecting your mood/symptoms. The default categories to log are good, but you can add/remove/edit all of the categories to fit you better. It's super easy to fill out, even when I'm not feeling well. It (sometimes) feels like I'm logging meaningless information, but then when I click on the Insights tab, it shows me tons of relevant information about which factors are influencing my mood (or any other symptom I log!). Turns out listening to music and video chats work wonders for my mood--good to know! This is also a wonderful way to record how I'm feeling over time--it lets me easily decipher long-term changes in my wellbeing, which is great information to discuss with medical professionals.

I really like this app, it's easy to use and the design is nice and the ability to customize it to your needs is great. However, the syncing isn't very reliable. I have a phone and a tablet, and downloaded it on both, I tried to log in on the tablet, and only a few entries were visible. Later I went to look at the one on my phone, and half the entries are gone, and so are factors I added. I want to keep using this app, but if it's going to randomly forget things that's a problem.

I have tried multiple times in the past to find a way that I could easily log my moods in a way that felt nuanced and meaningful but also flexible and customizable, but this is the first app I have ever seen that got it right. For once, I am finding it convenient to do quick check ins and even monitor my food and water intake which I never thought I'd have the patience to do. You don't have to get premium, but it's well worth it at least to support a great app.

Brilliant App & well worth paying for. I wanted an app to record daily symptoms to enable me to give an accurate report to my GP. This app has everything I wanted & more. Being able to write notes by each symptom is so helpful & the insight reports are incredible. I did have a little snag when I first signed up for the free trial, but I made contact, explained the situation & James helped me to sort it all out. The app has been fantastic ever since. Thank you bearable team üôèüèªü•∞

title: Headaches Migraines App 1
description:
Relieve Migraine Headaches Naturally


There are many new migraine headache treatments available that can be both safe and effective. Natural treatments for migraine headaches are usually safer and cheaper than traditional pain medications.



And in many instances they can relieve pain just as well or even better than prescription or non-prescription drugs. The possibility of a negative reaction to a safe and natural migraine headache treatment is still there, but it is less with most natural treatment methods than it is with pain-relieving medications.¬†



Every person on the face of the earth is unique. Their body chemistry is different than anyone else‚Äôs. One person may find relief from their migraine headaches with one type of treatment while someone else may try that same treatment and find no relief at all.



No two people will experience the same reaction from the same treatment. But why is that?



Every body is made up of a mixture of chemicals. Every person produces certain chemicals in their body so that they will be able to function at their best. Histamines will increase gastric secretion and dilate the capillaries.



Insulin is secreted by the pancreas and helps regulate the blood sugar levels. Hormones are produced by the body for many different functions. Adrenaline (epinephrine) is produced in response to stress.



Every body is unique and produces different chemicals in differing amounts. When a person takes aspirin (a chemical) for their migraine headaches it changes the chemical make-up of that person‚Äôs body.¬†



You‚Äôve always heard that when two chemicals, in the same amounts, at the same temperature, etc. are mixed together they will cause the same reaction.



That may be true, but when one chemical (such as aspirin) is taken by two separate people their reactions will never be exactly the same because no two people have identical chemicals in their body. One person taking aspirin will not have the same reaction as someone else taking aspirin. And it‚Äôs the same with natural migraine headache treatments.



Since no two people are identical no two people will respond exactly the same to a treatment method for migraine headaches.



So just because one migraine headache treatment does not work for one person does not mean it won‚Äôt work for your migraine headaches.



There are many effective alternatives to taking medications when it comes to relieving migraine headaches. You just have to try one for yourself to see if it will work for you.



One natural and popular treatment method for migraine headaches is chiropractic care, or chiropractic manipulations. Studies have shown that over 80% of headache patients find some type of relief for their headaches with chiropractic treatment.



And chiropractic treatment has been shown to be extremely safe. Spinal problems cause headaches and when these spinal problems are treated by chiropractors a high percentage of their patients experience relieve from their pain.¬†



Another natural way to relieve migraine headaches is biofeedback. This is a safe and potentially effective way to eliminate pain.



Biofeedback is not actually a treatment, but a training program designed to help a person develop the ability to control their autonomic (involuntary) nervous system.



Functions that are normally automatic in the body, such as blood pressure regulation or heart rate can be controlled voluntarily. This technique makes it possible for a person to control their own heart rate, blood pressure, skin temperature or relaxation of their muscles.



It‚Äôs no secret that stress causes muscle tension. And nobody will deny that muscle tension causes pain and headaches. And it‚Äôs also a fact that by relaxing this muscle tension, especially in the neck and head, it is possible to relieve the migraine headaches or neck pain that is being caused by the tension.

title: Migraine
description:
Migraines are characterized by severe head pain often accompanied by other symptoms, which can be disabling in nature. These migraine symptoms include but are not limited to: nausea, vomiting, difficulty speaking, numbness or tingling, and sensitivity to light and sound. Migraines often tend to run in families, and recent research has identified certain genetic components. Migraines can affect people of all ages and often go undiagnosed in young children.

The duration of a migraine attack can vary, however most migraine attacks will last at least four hours. If you are experiencing symptoms for more than three days, you should seek help from your physician or visit the Emergency Room.

title: Headache Wizard
description:
Headache Wizard is a headache journal to help you and your doctor track your headaches as well as potential triggers and preventatives. But it's not just your average headache journal. This app allows you to customize your suspected triggers and preventatives in the the form of "factors". These factors will then be correlated to your headache days and headache-free days automatically. All you have to do is make your journal entries every day.

- Easy to use calendar allows you to see your headache history at a glance
- Headache journal that visually shows you possible triggers
- Enter your own custom suspected triggers and preventatives

title: Curable: Back Pain, Migraine & Chronic Pain Relief
description:
Take control over chronic pain with the Curable app. Our step-by-step program will help you learn what is happening in your body and apply practical tools to reverse the cycle of pain. Let our smart coach, Clara, guide you through the latest developments in pain science with fun, easy-to-understand audio lessons. Identify, target, and eliminate the factors that are keeping your pain ‚Äústuck‚Äù through a series of guided, evidence-based exercises. Curable is a new type of chronic pain app, helping you to retrain your brain and nervous system for long-term results.

What you can do in the app:

-Learn about the neuroscience of pain through engaging audio lessons

-Reduce hypervigilence and fear of pain through practical, easy-to-apply techniques

-Optimize your nervous system to handle flare-ups more effectively with the ‚ÄúPanic Button"

-Calm your mind and body with guided meditations and visualizations specifically designed to target pain factors

-Reprocess strong emotions and life events that may have contributed to the development of pain

-Listen to interviews with physicians, pain scientists, and other experts

-Create a practical plan for re-incorporating joy and movement into your life

-Gain a new perspective on your symptoms and their significance through cognitive reframing

-Customize your experience by providing ongoing feedback to your smart coach, Clara

-Find inspiration, motivation, and support within our private community

The Curable program is evidence-based, and is recommended by physicians, physical therapists, and pain psychologists all over the world. It can be an important part of a treatment plan for migraine, fibromyalgia, neck & shoulder pain, back pain, sciatica, nerve pain, foot pain, hip pain, knee pain, RSI, hand and wrist pain, and more. 70% of Curable users experience some degree of relief in physical symptoms after just 30 days in the program.

Learn through engaging audio lessons that explain the neuroscience of pain as it applies to different aspects of life:
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉPerfectionism
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉPeople Pleasing
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉAnxiety
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉDepression
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉSelf Esteem
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉExpectations
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉAdversity
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉCaregiving
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉParenting
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉMajor Life Events
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉPTSD
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉChildhood Stress
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉThe Stress of Pain
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉTriggers

Retrain your brain to lessen the experience of pain through exercises of meditation, reflection, writing, CBT, and visualizations. For stories of recovery from real users, please read our reviews. To learn more about our approach, check out our podcast on iTunes: ‚ÄúLike Mind, Like Body."

IN THE PRESS:

"Very rarely, an app comes along that changes your life. I want to tell you about such an app, and how it changed mine.‚Äù
-Jon Evans, TechCrunch, ‚ÄòCuring the Incurable'

‚ÄúA multidisciplinary pain program at the Mayo Clinic in Minnesota for treatment very similar to what Curable does (but in-person) costs $40,000.‚Äù -BizWest, 'App may change way patients, physicians approach chronic pain'

On "The Mighty":
'13 Favorite Apps for People With Chronic Conditions'
and '16 Products People With Chronic Pain Swear by That Fit in Your Purse'

Also featured in:
Women‚Äôs Health
Shape
Venture Beat
Elite Daily
Brit+Co

SUBSCRIPTION PRICING & TERMS
Curable offers the following auto-renewing subscriptions:
1 month: $14.99
1 year: $119.99

This price is for US customers. Pricing in other countries will be converted to your local currency depending on your country of residence.

Your subscription will automatically renew unless your subscription is canceled at least 24 hrs before the end of the current period. To manage your subscription go to your Google Play store and to Subscriptions. 

Curable also offers a Lifetime subscription which is paid for by a one-time upfront payment of $299.99 for unlimited access to the Curable app.

Privacy Policy:
https://www.curablehealth.com/privacy
Terms of Service:
https://www.curablehealth.com/terms

comments: Content is great... When I can access it. If I pause a recording it is very hard to get out to open again. I have to try repeatedly and don't know if it will work. I've given up and read the transcripts for some things but that doesn't work well for a meditation. Please fix these bugs!

I think this is a brilliant app and my pain is so much more manageable after only a month. My reason for only giving 4 stars is that an awful lot of the work is going back to childhood. I have done years of therapy and I just don't need this so a lot of exercises etc are useless to me. Some brain training exercises and the somatic taking is really helpful... Building new neural pathways.

As a musician, RSI has had a significant effect on me for years and finally now I'm able to play again. The app works on the premise that after the source of pain has healed, the sensation can remain because the brain gets stuck in a pain loop, exacerbated by anxiety and anticipation of the pain. The app is based on valid (and relatively recent) research and I'm delighted to say it has worked for me. Thank you Curable.

Great concept but app needs some fixing I love curable and what they do. The content is great but sometimes my meditations stop playing somewhere half way and it ruins the whole meditation experience. Another thing is sometimes the shortcut for the meditation will stay on my drop-down in which nothing will make it disappear unless I restart my phone. Just a bug I'm assuming hopefully the developers fix this

This app may help you. You will need to be able to tune your body to certain unknown frequencies and believe that the MRI study they refer to was not a flawed study from the start. If you are easily brainwashed this is the app for you. Worth a try if you are in constant pain. Good luck.

title: Pain Diary - Pain Management Log
description:
This log can help you track the everyday things that have an impact on your pain. When you understand what makes your pain worse, you can begin to work on ways to reduce or deal with your pain ‚Äútriggers.‚Äù

The more you know about how your body reacts, the more you can be in control. And being in better control can help you be less afraid and better able to manage your pain. 

This app makes it easy to track your pain & symptoms and report to your doctors. Use our pain diary to keep track of your pain over time and share it with your doctor at your next appointment. Track a variety of pain elements, including location, pain duration, triggers and more.

A pain diary is used to monitor levels of pain over a long period of time and collect data on possible triggers for that pain. One solution pain doctors recommend is keeping a pain diary, a consistent record of your pain experience.

Your doctor will be looking for triggers, stresses, and patterns. The more detailed you can be about the factors that seem to influence your pain, the better. An accurate record of your pain will help your doctor give you the best treatment.

Why a Pain Journal Works for Chronic Pain
This information is useful both for you and your doctor. It can be used to help identify patterns of pain, such as time of day or level of stress, or pain triggers from certain activities. A pain journal can also show what doesn‚Äôt increase your pain, which can help you make better decisions about how you spend your day. 

What exactly do you log in a pain journal? Everybody uses their journal differently, but in this app you can do the following:
- Give your pain a scale rating. We use the pain scale with the 0-10 rating system, with 0 representing no pain and 10 representing the worst imaginable pain. Your pain will usually fall somewhere in between.
- Use pain descriptor words. Using pain descriptor words in your journal can help you track changes and patterns in your pain quality. It can also help doctors pinpoint your type of pain.
- Track the time of day pain occurs. 
- Note what you are doing when your pain begins. 
- Look at elements that might contribute to your pain.
- Write down what you ate and drank that day.
- Describe your mood

title: Zutool:headache forecast
description:
A worldwide version of a popular app that has been featured in many Japanese media!

‚ÄúFeeling unwell on a rainy morning‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚ÄúHope to choose a day when there is no headache for travel and important meetings‚Ä¶‚Äù 

Zutool is a physical condition management assisting app based on the atmospheric(barometric) pressure forecast devised by a weather forecaster, paying attention to headaches and other pain caused by changes in atmospheric pressure, called "weather pain". You can use the atmospheric(barometric) pressure forecast chart to predict and confirm when pain is likely to occur.

This app is free to use.
There are also additional service(charged) with all features available without a limit called 'Premium Service' through In-App Purchase. 

Atmospheric(barometric) pressure affects human body!?
We‚Äôve got about 15 tons of air pressing down on us in our daily life! Recent research suggests that changes in atmospheric(barometric) pressure are one of the causes of various disorders such as headaches, migraines, shoulder pain, and dizziness.

Other main symptoms of weather pains(meteoropathy) are; 
Headache, migraine, back pain, asthma, depression, dizziness, shoulder pain, low blood pressure, nausea, frustration, joint pain, myocardial infarction(heart attack), cerebral infarction(stroke), neuralgia(nerve pain), and Meniere's disease. You may feel more unwell due to the stress reaction of the autonomic nerves when the body tries to adjust to atmospheric(barometric) pressure.

‚ÄòZutool‚Äò was developed to predict headache, which is one of a weather pain, in advance by paying attention to changes in atmospheric(barometric) pressure.

‚óÜ‚óá‚óÜ‚óáWhat you can do on this app‚óÜ‚óá‚óÜ‚óá
- Headache prediction with atmospheric(barometric) pressure forecast up to 36 hours in the chart
- Pain & medicine record; easy recording of pain occurrence, medication and notes.
- Weather and temperature forecast of every 3 hours
- Low pressure alert display on the barometric pressure chart when it drops significantly below normal.
- Location registration with GPS

‚óÜ‚óá‚óÜ‚óáPremium Service additional function‚óÜ‚óá‚óÜ‚óá
30-days free trial for first time subscribers(In-App Purchase).
Additional features are;
-Past 90 days of Pain record -> Unlimited
-36 hours ahead forecasts ->extended to 144 hours ahead forecasts
-No ads displayed

Download this app, then register from the ‚ÄòRegister Premium Service‚Äô. Premium Service will be automatically charged monthly, unless you cancel it at least 24 hours before the trial ends.

title: Headache Guide
description: If you are one of the millions of people who suffer from headaches, set an appointment with your primary care physician. A doctor can help identify different types of headaches, which include: tension, migraine, cluster, hormone, sinus and rebound. Your doctor will present accompanying pain relief treatments based on your symptoms and also ask you consider modifying your lifestyle to avoid headache pain. If your regular doctor's suggestions do not alleviate the headaches, consider visiting a headache specialist for more help.

title: Headache Help
description:
Do you want to have a good concentration, feel fresh, fall into sleep easily, have physical strength and endurance and achieve your work duties and social goals?

With this app, we have compiled ancient remedies for headache. We give you only the successful ones. Here is the table of contents:

--What is headache?

--Headache symptoms

--Interesting facts

--Herbal cures

--Chinese herbal cures

--Ayurveda

--Homeopathic remedies

--Bach Flower remedies

--Aromatherapy

--Traditional home and folk remedies

--Vitamins and minerals as support

How to use this app?

There are three important buttons:

-- Your Therapy

-- Symptoms

-- Description of remedies 

First tap on Symptoms and then tap on one or more icons that say Add to Your Therapy. You will see a short message ("toast") that the symptom is entered into the therapy.

You can select all symptoms that you want now or later, it does not matter. Once entered, you will be able to delete the chosen symptom with a click of a button.

Then tap on various groups of remedies. Typically, these will be Homeopathy, Bach Flower remedies, Ayurveda and others. Visit these therapies and tap on icon to select the remedy and enter it into the chosen therapy.

Finally, tap on Your Therapy. You will see a list of symptoms (in orange) mixed with a list of remedies (green) that you have selected. Taken together, the symptoms and the remedies form your therapy. Now all you have to do is obtain the remedies and start the process of eventual improvement of your health.

The whole process takes less than five minutes but will cut down the time to search for remedies. We have chosen only the proven remedies from various types of healing so let this be a firm base for further research of yours. In the meantime, you undertook the first step towards the change of your life.

If the symptoms change, you may repeat the entire process.

The app is free and is supported by (hopefully non intrusive) ads. This app belongs to a wider group of apps that may be able to help you improve your health. Please visit the option Other apps to see what else do we have.

title: Manage My Pain
description:
Chronic pain affects 1 in 5 individuals. It can be hard to explain to friends, family, and doctors. It can feel like it's taking control of your life and your mental health. Learn to conquer your chronic pain. Manage My Pain helps you and others better understand what you are going through. It has helped thousands of people with conditions like fibromyalgia, headaches, arthritis, or back pain better understand their symptoms and provide evidence of their pain for their doctors, insurance companies, or government agencies. Manage My Pain was created in partnership with industry-leading pain researchers - your doctor will actually read the reports from our app! Our daily reflections help people focus on their meaningful activities as opposed to the limitations created by their pain.

Manage My Pain will help you:
‚Ä¢ Record how you're feeling: Easily describe your pain in less than 30 seconds
‚Ä¢ Understand your unique pain criteria: Fully customizable options with each pain record let you identify factors such as how your pain feels, what the factors made the pain worse, which medications help you with your pain, and many more
‚Ä¢ Reflect on your day: Take your mind off pain and record activities that are meaningful to you
‚Ä¢ Highlight patterns and trends: Charts and graphs describe your results and get more powerful over time
‚Ä¢ Track how well your meds are working: Add any medication to your profile and mark if it helps manage your pain
‚Ä¢ Describe your pain to your doctor: Summarize your pain through unique reports that your doctor will actually read

Developed for patients suffering from and care-givers or medical professionals treating: 
‚Ä¢ arthritis & rheumatism
‚Ä¢ cancer 
‚Ä¢ chronic pain
‚Ä¢ headaches & migraines 
‚Ä¢ fibromyalgia 

Use this pain management app to replace your hand-written: 
‚Ä¢ pain diary 
‚Ä¢ pain journal 
‚Ä¢ pain log 
‚Ä¢ pain tracker 

The Pro version adds the ability to view or report on more than the last 30 days. comments: **UPDATE** after receiving response from customer support (which was expedient and right on the money for what I needed). I absolutely LOVE this app!!! (upgrade from 4 stars to 5!!) Once I was clear on how to use app, I really appreciate having somewhere to log my daily concerns. I do wish there were more specific body parts, but I LOVE that u can put notes in and be more specific there.

Really great free app with incredibly reasonably priced premium levels (although I've not needed to upgrade from free yet so can't comment on their pros & cons). You can add your own pain descriptors and chart things like mental fog and fatigue. It doesn't take too long to fill out and you can easily change the entry date. The only thing I "don't like" is that it defaults to filling out the daily reflection rather than pain when opening the app. Definitely recommend for chronic pain sufferers!

Really useful for tracking pain, and I like all the options they give you for stuff. Plus you can make your own! I just started tracking my pain and this app has helped give a visual of how much I neglect to address my physical health. Glad I stumbled upon this :)

I started using this app because I know I will need a lengthy history to be diagnosed with fibromyalgia. I like how easy this app is to use and record my daily symptoms and over all how Im feeling. This app is super helpful.
Love this. Most apps that track your activities etc are very limited without subscribing but this one has a lot of free features and is a great way of keeping track of patterns

title: Headache (Guide)
description: Nothing can put a damper on your day like a headache. If you're experiencing headaches frequently, make some changes. Too much stress, sun, alcohol, or caffeine can lead to frequent headaches, so tweaking your routine can help. If avoiding headache triggers does not help with your headaches, talk to a doctor. An underlying health condition may be to blame
